title: Why is the Sense of Morality more Important than Capitalism?

content.html: Morality navigates us through life when there are infinite directions one could potentially take. Morality vastly restricts the number of pathways one could take.

It could be something that the “self” wants but it could be wrong. It is wrong because it does not work out well if you play it out in the future for any number of years. All the circumstances of every individual might be different but the choices ones take concert the potential of the present to the Karma of the future.
If you are 30 and miserable then it is all your doing. The choices that you might have taken when navigating the world might have been wrong and this is where it has got you!

Don’t you worry! It is never too late to change yourself. For Being is always JUST. It delivers on to you what is rightfully yours and if you think if you have escaped it then it might be your children’s burden to carry them forward. That does not absolve you from anything, that just means that karma takes the form through your child or society and will haunt you when you are old or will forever taint your image after you are dead.

Let us say who cares about death and what happens after one dies, all that matters is now and what happens next. But, what happens next is up to you and the choices that you make will affect you and others surrounding you. I am sure that no one in their right mind would want something bad for their loved ones or their children.
What happens to a society without morality?

Let’s look at India for example. It’s a typical example in my experience. After the year 2000, there was the globalization of India and thus all the companies that could never have opened a branch in India can!

This meant that the ideologies of the US seeped into Indian cities destroying the concepts of religion in certain members of the population but that also meant that people are no longer constrained by anything. It is a true sense of freedom in some sense which is why it is enticing. A weak soul is always attracted to the fallacies of the fantasies without caring about the future consequences that wait for them.

Thus moving ever so slowly away from religion and everything good about it. Including morality. All of which are now destroyed. Now, we can do anything legal, in other words, the law is the only thing preventing someone from doing horrible things to each other to earn more money.

I do not remember the name of the Netflix documentary but there was a short-term lending company in the US that lent money to typically poor people for a fixed fee, at least that’s what the people who took the short-term loan thought. Once they got the money from the company they found out that they were paying much more than they initially thought they have to pay. Upon contacting the firm they found out that everything was written in small text like terms and conditions so they were legally covered.

Imagine this happening to someone who got a 300$ Loan. They took the loan because they did not have that money in the first place now they have paid 500$ in total to the firm to repay the short-term loan in under 3 months and only then are they able to fully repay the short-term loans. These are single mothers with 2 or more kids, truck drivers, divorcees who could not get through to the end of the month with what they earn.

The company was closed down and the top management was put in jail for a long term even though they were legally covered. In the end, the CEO said “we did not do anything illegal, everything that we did was legal, this is unfair”.

What did they do wrong? What is missing? We all know immediately that even though they did everything legally there is something fundamentally wrong. I did not understand that documentary then I was left confused because I was a pure capitalist then but I know now why the judge chose to sentence the top management and close down the company.
The company completely lacked a sense of morality!!

Morality is the right way of living that will only bring you good in the future. This is only if you do not fool yourself that something bad is a sense of morality or take an ideology and live by it! In the end, all ideologies are fundamentally flawed since one ideology can never encompass the whole of humanity and our evolutionary sense of right and wrong.

What is right is how you navigate the world that is truly beneficial for you and your loved ones now and in the future. An impulse is sometimes right but most times wrong, you eat a large plate of Biriyani and once the satisfaction subsides, all that we are left with is the guilt if our goal is to keep ourselves in shape and reduce our weight. We have all been there!!
Do what you know to be right and try to become a better person by letting morality guide you to the future.
